snippet.title: Parity-Time Synthetic Laser
snippet.description: Parity-Time Synthetic Laser / Feng, Liang ; Wong, Zi Jing ; Ma, Renmin ; Wang, Yuan ; Zhang, Xiang Parity-time (PT) symmetry is a fundamental notion in quantum field theories1,2. [...] arXiv:1405.2863. \- 2014\. - 16 p. Preprint

snippet.title: All-order renormalization of propagator matrix for Majorana fermions with inter-generation mixing
snippet.description: All-order renormalization of propagator matrix for Majorana fermions with inter-generation mixing / Kniehl, Bernd A We consider a mixed system of unstable Majorana fermions in a general parity-nonconserving theory and renormalize its propagator matrix to all orders in the pole scheme, in which the squares of the renormalized masses are identified with the complex pole positions and the wave-function renormalization (WFR) matrices are adjusted in compliance with the Lehmann-Symanzik-Zimmermann reduction formalism. [...] arXiv:1404.5908 ; DESY 14-007. \- 2014\. - 20 p. Preprint
Analytic Functions 19 - 25 Apr 1979 \- Kozubnik, Poland / Ławrynowicz, Julian (ed.) Berlin : Springer, 1980 e-proceedings

snippet.title: PT-symmetry breaking with divergent potentials: lattice and continuum cases
snippet.description: PT-symmetry breaking with divergent potentials: lattice and continuum cases / Joglekar, Yogesh N ; Scott, Derek D ; Saxena, Avadh We investigate the parity- and time-reversal ($\mathcal{PT}$)-symmetry breaking in lattice models in the presence of long-ranged, non-hermitian, $\mathcal{PT}$-symmetric potentials that remain finite or become divergent in the continuum limit. [...] arXiv:1403.4204. \- 2014\. - 6 p. Preprint

snippet.title: Complex analysis and geometry
snippet.description: Complex analysis and geometry / Ancona, Vincenzo (ed.) ; Silva, Alessandro (ed.) The papers in this wide-ranging collection report on the results of investigations from a number of linked disciplines, including complex algebraic geometry, complex analytic geometry of manifolds and spaces, and complex differential geometry.. Boston : Springer, 1993.

snippet.title: Hierarchically deflated conjugate gradient
snippet.description: Hierarchically deflated conjugate gradient / Boyle, P A We present a multi-level algorithm for the solution of five dimensional chiral fermion formulations, including domain wall and Mobius Fermions. [...] arXiv:1402.2585 ; EDINBURGH 2014-03. \- 2014\. - 37 p. Preprint

snippet.title: Indirect Detection Signatures for the Origin of Asymmetric Dark Matter
snippet.description: Indirect Detection Signatures for the Origin of Asymmetric Dark Matter / Zhao, Yue ; Zurek, Kathryn M We study the decay signatures of Asymmetric Dark Matter (ADM) via higher dimension operators which are responsible for generating the primordial dark matter (DM) asymmetry. [...] arXiv:1401.7664 ; MCTP-14-02. \- 2014\. Preprint

snippet.title: Linear Spinor Fields in Relativistic Dynamics
snippet.description: Linear Spinor Fields in Relativistic Dynamics / Lindesay, James Linear spinor fields are a generalization of the Dirac field that have transparent cluster decomposability properties needed for classical correspondence of relativistic quantum systems. [...] arXiv:1312.0541. \- 2013\. - 13 p. Preprint

snippet.title: Nuclear medicine radiation dosimetry
snippet.description: Nuclear medicine radiation dosimetry / McParland, Brian J Complexities of the requirements for accurate radiation dosimetry evaluation in both diagnostic and therapeutic nuclear medicine (including PET) have grown over the past decade [...] Dordrecht : Springer, 2010. - 632 p.

snippet.title: Optically pumped atoms
snippet.description: Optically pumped atoms / Happer, William Covering the most important knowledge on optical pumping of atoms, this ready reference is backed by numerous examples of modelling computation for optical pumped systems [...] Hoboken, NJ : Wiley, 2010. - 248 p.
